item.title: Encoding and Decoding JSON in PureScript
item.description: Yesterday I wrote my first JSON encoder and decoder for a main data type in my application, and I want to walk you through my experience. I started out by attempting to leverage Generic types to get encoding/decoding for free, but found that I couldn’t do that learned about automatically encoding/decoding Generic types, as well as writing manual parsers.

item.title: About
item.description: I’m learning PureScript while I build a new web app called FuzzyTime. The app aims to be an alternative for Doodle with more flexible scheduling, making it easier to schedule over broader ranges of time, and taking participants actual preferences into account. The backend is dead-simple, and the frontend is a single-page app written in PureScript and pux. This blog mainly chronicles what I’ve learned while building the latter.
